alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 11 at 2:23PM MDT until September 11 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Advisory for... West central Hidalgo County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until 615 PM MDT. * At 221 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was seen along Interstate 10 west of Lordsburg. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong winds up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Department of Transportation traffic cameras. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. Scattered thunderstorms this afternoon may produce strong outflows and areas of blowing dust on the Lordsburg Playa. * This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 22. Locations impacted include... Steins, Lordsburg, Road Forks, Lordsburg Playa, and Shakespeare. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
